questions.question: What is the name of your project?
What measurable financial benefits will this project generate, such as revenue growth or cost savings?
How does this project align with the company's strategic goals or competitive priorities?
To what extent will this project improve process efficiency or operational performance?
How will this project enhance employee productivity or reduce manual work?
How urgent is this project? Are there external deadlines, regulatory pressures, or market needs driving it?
What is the estimated capital expenditure required to initiate or build the project?
What are the expected ongoing operational expenses (OpEx) to maintain this project?
What level of maintenance effort or cost will be required after deployment?
How long will it take for this project to achieve a positive return on investment (ROI)?
Is this project directly linked to any company-wide or departmental OKRs?
Does this project provide a competitive advantage or create a market differentiator?
Will this project help the organization build new skills, technologies, or operational capabilities?
Does this project address any regulatory, compliance, or audit-related requirements?
What level of technical effort or complexity is required to implement this project?
Is the necessary data available, accessible, and of good quality for this project?
How difficult will it be for users or teams to adopt and integrate this solution into daily operations?
Does your team have the required skills to execute and maintain this project effectively?
How well does this project fit with your current technology stack and infrastructure?
Does this project have strong sponsorship or advocacy from leadership?
Are the goals, deliverables, and success metrics of this project clearly defined?
Does this project adhere to internal company policies, legal frameworks, or ethical standards?
